verses.text: Woe is me! for I am as when they have gathered the summer fruits , as the grapegleanings of the vintage : \add there is\add* no cluster to eat : my soul desired the firstripe fruit.\f + \fr 7.1 \ft when…: Heb. the gatherings of summer\f*

The good \add man\add* is perished out of the earth : and \add there is\add* none upright among men : they all lie in wait for blood ; they hunt every man his brother with a net.\f + \fr 7.2 \ft good: or, godly, or, merciful\f* \p

¶ That they may do evil with both hands earnestly , the prince asketh , and the judge \add asketh\add* for a reward ; and the great \add man\add*, he uttereth his mischievous desire : so they wrap it up.\f + \fr 7.3 \ft his…: Heb. the mischief of his soul\f*
The best of them \add is\add* as a brier : the most upright \add is sharper\add* than a thorn hedge : the day of thy watchmen \add and\add* thy visitation cometh ; now shall be their perplexity. \p
¶ Trust ye not in a friend , put ye not confidence in a guide : keep the doors of thy mouth from her that lieth in thy bosom.
For the son dishonoureth the father , the daughter riseth up against her mother , the daughter in law against her mother in law ; a man’s enemies \add are\add* the men of his own house. \p
Therefore I will look unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*; I will wait for the God of my salvation : my God will hear me. \p
¶ Rejoice not against me, O mine enemy : when I fall , I shall arise ; when I sit in darkness , the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* \add shall be\add* a light unto me.

I will bear the indignation of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, because I have sinned against him, until he plead my cause , and execute judgment for me: he will bring me forth to the light , \add and\add* I shall behold his righteousness.

Then \add she that is\add* mine enemy shall see \add it\add*, and shame shall cover her which said unto me, Where is the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God ? mine eyes shall behold her: now shall she be trodden down as the mire of the streets.\f + \fr 7.10 \ft Then…: or, And thou wilt see her that is mine enemy, and cover her with shame\f*\f + \fr 7.10 \ft shall she…: Heb. she shall be for a treading down\f*
\add In\add* the day that thy walls are to be built , \add in\add* that day shall the decree be far removed.

\add In\add* that day \add also\add* he shall come even to thee from Assyria , and \add from\add* the fortified cities , and from the fortress even to the river , and from sea to sea , and \add from\add* mountain to mountain.\f + \fr 7.12 \ft and from the fortified cities: or, even to the fortified cities\f*
Notwithstanding the land shall be desolate because of them that dwell therein, for the fruit of their doings.\f + \fr 7.13 \ft Notwithstanding: or, After that it hath been\f* \p

¶ Feed thy people with thy rod , the flock of thine heritage , which dwell solitarily \add in\add* the wood , in the midst of Carmel : let them feed \add in\add* Bashan and Gilead , as in the days of old.\f + \fr 7.14 \ft Feed: or, Rule\f*
According to the days of thy coming out of the land of Egypt will I shew unto him marvellous \add things\add*. \p
¶ The nations shall see and be confounded at all their might : they shall lay \add their\add* hand upon \add their\add* mouth , their ears shall be deaf.

They shall lick the dust like a serpent , they shall move out of their holes like worms of the earth : they shall be afraid of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* our God , and shall fear because of thee.\f + \fr 7.17 \ft worms: or, creeping things\f*

Who \add is\add* a God like unto thee, that pardoneth iniquity , and passeth by the transgression of the remnant of his heritage ? he retaineth not his anger for ever , because he delighteth \add in\add* mercy.
He will turn again , he will have compassion upon us; he will subdue our iniquities ; and thou wilt cast all their sins into the depths of the sea.
Thou wilt perform the truth to Jacob , \add and\add* the mercy to Abraham , which thou hast sworn unto our fathers from the days of old.
